titleStmt.title: M. G. Settley to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10073

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: to the govner of ky I do certefy that Wiley Carragins childern in said pertition was find By me and a Justice of the peace for Jackson county and I say that a part of the Evidence was found to Be fals the Comonwelth Evidece Stated as fouls to wit that she cam to said curragun efter sum gees and mrs Carragin came out and told her to take them gees tel She look at them and mrs carragin told her to take them on for the was hers and then carragin came up ^and^ found By 3 evidence that mrs carragin told her that these gees was hern and not to take them of Ef She did that She wold make her pay for them and and carragin children came up and went to drive these gees Back and the fra came up and Eliz angle a reck and hit carragin girl and and I think that sad Carragin were dun in Justrice in sade trial for fining hin $200
M. G Settley J P J C

Jackson
J. P.
$20. } breach
remitted
B. M
Sarah, Lewis, Janes & Clark Carragin
Issd Feby 7. 1861
